channel.title: CVE Feed for Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba Mobility Conductor (formerly Mobility Master); Aruba Mobility Controllers; WLAN Gateways and SD-WAN Gateways managed by Aruba Central
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) -- Aruba Mobility Conductor (formerly Mobility Master); Aruba Mobility Controllers; WLAN Gateways and SD-WAN Gateways managed by Aruba Central

item.title: CVE-2023-22752|2024-08-02T10:20:30.410Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: There are stack-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba Networks access point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2023-22771|2024-08-02T10:20:30.380Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: An insufficient session expiration vulnerability exists in the ArubaOS command line interface. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability allows an attacker to keep a session running on an affected device after the removal of the impacted account

item.title: CVE-2023-22760|2024-08-02T10:20:30.221Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: Authenticated remote command injection vulnerabilities exist in the ArubaOS web-based management interface. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary commands as a privileged user on the underlying operating system. This allows an attacker to fully compromise the underlying operating system on the device running ArubaOS.

item.title: CVE-2023-22774|2024-08-02T10:20:31.081Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: Authenticated path traversal vulnerabilities exist in the ArubaOS command line interface. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to delete arbitrary files in the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2023-22769|2024-08-02T10:20:31.068Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: Authenticated command injection vulnerabilities exist in the ArubaOS command line interface. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary commands as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2023-22772|2024-08-02T10:20:30.322Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: An authenticated path traversal vulnerability exists in the ArubaOS web-based management interface. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to delete arbitrary files in the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2023-22754|2024-08-02T10:20:30.250Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: There are buffer overflow vulnerabilities in multiple underlying operating system processes that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets via the PAPI protocol. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2023-22749|2024-08-02T10:20:30.413Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: There are multiple command injection vulnerabilities that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba Networks access point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2023-22768|2024-08-02T10:20:30.402Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: Authenticated command injection vulnerabilities exist in the ArubaOS command line interface. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary commands as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2023-35971|2024-08-02T16:37:40.574Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: A vulnerability in the ArubaOS web-based management interface could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to conduct a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the interface. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary script code in a victim's browser in the context of the affected interface.

item.title: CVE-2023-22763|2024-08-02T10:20:30.355Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: Authenticated command injection vulnerabilities exist in the ArubaOS command line interface. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary commands as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2023-35978|2024-08-02T16:37:40.548Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: A vulnerability in ArubaOS could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to conduct a reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the web-based management interface. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary script code in a victim's browser in the context of the affected interface.

item.title: CVE-2023-22748|2024-08-02T10:20:30.367Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: There are multiple command injection vulnerabilities that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba Networks access point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2023-35977|2024-08-02T16:37:40.588Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: Vulnerabilities exist which allow an authenticated attacker to access sensitive information on the ArubaOS command line interface. Successful exploitation could allow access to data beyond what is authorized by the users existing privilege level.

item.title: CVE-2023-22778|2024-08-02T10:20:30.383Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: A vulnerability in the ArubaOS web management interface could allow an authenticated remote attacker to conduct a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) attack against a user of the interface. A successful exploit could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary script code in a victim's browser in the context of the affected interface.

item.description: An authenticated information disclosure vulnerability exists in the ArubaOS web-based management interface. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to read arbitrary files in the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2023-22750|2024-08-02T10:20:30.245Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: There are multiple command injection vulnerabilities that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba Networks access point management protocol) UDP port (8211). item.title: CVE-2023-35979|2024-08-02T16:37:40.612Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: There is an unauthenticated buffer overflow vulnerability in the process controlling the ArubaOS web-based management interface. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in a Denial-of-Service (DoS) condition affecting the web-based management interface of the controller.

item.title: CVE-2023-22753|2024-08-02T10:20:30.255Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: There are buffer overflow vulnerabilities in multiple underlying operating system processes that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets via the PAPI protocol. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2023-22776|2024-08-02T10:20:30.370Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: An authenticated path traversal vulnerability exists in the ArubaOS command line interface. Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to read arbitrary files on the underlying operating system, including sensitive system files.

item.title: CVE-2023-22756|2024-08-02T10:20:30.377Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: There are buffer overflow vulnerabilities in multiple underlying operating system processes that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets via the PAPI protocol. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2023-22773|2024-08-02T10:20:30.673Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: Authenticated path traversal vulnerabilities exist in the ArubaOS command line interface. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to delete arbitrary files in the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2023-22757|2024-08-02T10:20:30.331Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: There are buffer overflow vulnerabilities in multiple underlying operating system processes that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets via the PAPI protocol. Successful exploitation of these vulnerabilities result in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-26305|2024-08-02T00:07:19.370Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: There is a buffer overflow vulnerability in the underlying Utility daemon that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's access point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-26304|2024-08-02T00:07:19.227Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: There is a buffer overflow vulnerability in the underlying L2/L3 Management service that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's access point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-26305|2024-06-04T17:49:30.019Z -- hewlett%20packard%20enterprise%20%28hpe%29 -- aruba%20mobility%20conductor%20%28formerly%20mobility%20master%29%3B%20aruba%20mobility%20controllers%3B%20wlan%20gateways%20and%20sd-wan%20gateways%20managed%20by%20aruba%20central
item.description: There is a buffer overflow vulnerability in the underlying Utility daemon that could lead to unauthenticated remote code execution by sending specially crafted packets destined to the PAPI (Aruba's access point management protocol) UDP port (8211). Successful exploitation of this vulnerability results in the ability to execute arbitrary code as a privileged user on the underlying operating system.
